    • Method Detail

      • log

        public void log(Logger.LoggerLevel level,
       java.lang.String message)
        Log with the required level and can provide a message.
        Parameters:
        level - The LoggerLevel of that message, will be reflected in the logger output.
        message - The message that should accompany the logger level in the output.

      • log

        public void log(Logger.LoggerLevel level,
       java.lang.String message,
       java.lang.Exception e)
        Log with the required level and can provide a message and an exception.
        Parameters:
        level - The LoggerLevel of that message, will be reflected in the logger output.
        message - The message that should accompany the logger level in the output.
        e - The exception that was provided with that error, is not required.

      • toggleDebug

        public boolean toggleDebug()
        Toggles the debug state in the logger.
        Returns:
        the new debug state.

      • getDebug

        public boolean getDebug()
        Used to get whether the logger is in debug state or not.
        Returns:
        the current debug state.
